title: Technical vs Fundamental Analysis
content: Technical Analysis studies price charts and patterns to predict future price movements. It assumes all information is reflected in the price. Tools include indicators (RSI, MACD), chart patterns, and volume analysis. Best for short-term trading. Fundamental Analysis evaluates a company's financial health, industry position, and economic factors. It examines earnings, revenue, debt, management quality, and competitive advantages. Best for long-term investing. Most successful investors use both approaches. Fintra focuses on Technical Analysis tools using historical data for educational purposes. Neither method can predict future prices with certainty.
